meanings.definition: Not exerting control or influence over others.
meanings.sent1: The quiet student preferred to stay in the nondominant role during group projects.
meanings.sent2: In the game of chess, the pawn is a nondominant piece compared to the queen.
meanings.sent3: During the office meeting, the boss jokingly referred to himself as the nondominant potato in the salad.
meanings.sent4: The nondominant clouds in the sky allowed the sun to shine brightly through.
meanings.sent5: The nondominant color in the painting added a subtle touch of elegance.

meanings.definition: Not being the most powerful or prevalent in a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: The nondominant team struggled to keep up with the leading group in the race.
meanings.sent2: Although he was talented, he remained in a nondominant position within the company.
meanings.sent3: The nondominant flavor in the dish surprised everyone with its unique taste.
meanings.sent4: Her nondominant presence at the party went unnoticed by most guests.
meanings.sent5: The nondominant tree in the forest stood quietly among its taller companions.
